entries.meaning: Either of two Scottish kitchen implements made of wood: a flat one for turning oatcakes, or a stick for stirring porridge.

description:
spirt +â€Ž -le?
According to the Poly-Olbion project, coined by poet Michael Drayton in 1606.

verbs.description: spurtle (third-person singular simple present spurtles, present participle spurtling, simple past and past participle spurtled)

entries.meaning: To spurt, spatter or sputter; to spurt in a scattering manner.
examples: Upon the head hee lent so violent a stroke,
That the poore emptie skull, like some thin potsheard broke,
The braines and mingled blood, were spertled on the wall
